For the next few minutes, the dog happily chewed away, tail wagging and appetite sated, until...
1131.title: ...released him to eat the food.

Mild pot belly. He drove out ever so often for fast food
Full blown gut. Fast food became a daily ritual
114.content:
Rain fell hard that September morning. It landed in an erratic cadence against the metal roof of the car. Hunter's ears twitched every time the windshield wipers screeched to and from their nest. Weren't these ones brand new?

Off the brakes, onto the gas. Past the intersection by Bobmart, then take a right. Stop again. Where do I go now?

Richard hesitated for a moment and looked to his GPS. Down a mile or two, then another right. He nodded to himself, only for red lights to illuminate the rain drops on the road. A gasp caught in his throat. He slammed on the brakes and punched his car horn. The car in front of him came to a complete stop, then turned.

The idiot didn't even use his blinkers.

He drove onward and pondered this new address. It mocked him from a crumpled piece of paper tossed to the passenger's seat. The scratchy handwriting only just legible.

"Can't talk much, need help, come to 3205 Wintersby Ave."

A stray hand reached to his face and scratched the scruff on his cheek. No sane person up and left over strange letters in the mail. Life in the city might drive you to it though. Any excuse to duck out and run to suburbia was enough for him. Even if the old neighborhoods became faint shadows of the past, colored only by wistful nostalgia.

The smoky smells of a family BBQ. Kids might play in the front yard, dousing each other with the watering-hose. Even the family dog might be tugging his master by the leash, searching for new and exciting smells.

Not that you would see anything like that those days.

His car passed by dilapidated homes, a few windows cracked. Some boarded up entirely. Weeds and tall grass overran yards. Vines ensnared rusted chain link fences in their snake-like grasp. Not a place to hang around for long. House 3205 looked no different.

Thunder clapped in the sky and the rain came down in heavier torrents the moment he parked his car.

"Wouldn't have predicted this." He mumbled

He slipped out of his car and jogged through the rain. The moment he reached the front door he pounded it with his fist and bent over his knees to catch his breath. Water soaked his back while he listened for someone to answer the door.

The door creaked open, the shadow of a face could be seen through the small crack.

"You sent me a letter, something about needing help?" Richard said over the roar of the rain.

"Your name?" Said the person behind the door.

"What? You wrote it on the envelope though."

"Your name."

"Richard Spritz." He said.

"Your old name."

"You know the law, that isn't my name anymore."

"No one's around to hear you."

"Fine, it's Hunter. Now can I come inside?"

The door whipped open to reveal a anthropomorphic husky. A bright smile lit up his face. Richard, or Hunter rather paused in his tracks and laughed.

"Yet another unexpected twist, yes?" Said the husky.

"Jeez Exile can't believe it's really you."

"Get in now, before eary people decide to report us." Exile said.

Hunter did as he was told while the door shut behind him.

"Wait, you mean nosy right?"

"Why would I say that? You smell with your nose."

Hunter shrugged and nodded. Same old Exile. Time changed him very little. Not that he could say the same of himself.

"What was the deal with my name out there?"

"A precaution. I feared they got you too."

"Precautions? They? Exile you're starting to sound like one of those conspiracy nuts on TV." Said Hunter.

The husky glared a little and folded his arms.

"Someone is rounding up former Rovers and...doing things to them. I found Blitz by accident the other day. I barely even recognized him! Weird boy always used to be so stressed about his looks, and to see him the way I did. Oh it was weird."

Hunter tilted his head and took a seat on the couch.

"I said to him 'Blitz, you look like you need to lay off the doggy biscuits' and he goes crazy. He said not to make fun of his glandular problem or something. Then he goes on about how he doesn't even know who Blitz is! That I had the wrong cano-sapien."

"He didn't even recognize you?"

"Not even a smallish bit." Said Exile. "So I decided to find the old Rovers myself, before something else happened. Colleen and Muzzle, they are at The Master's old lab."

"Any news on Shag?"

"Nope. I don't even know if he could read my letter." Said Exile.

The idea that someone was out there hunting the Rovers made Hunter want to shrink into himself. Maybe Parvo did it? No way, he's dead. Son of Parvo, Parvo's apprentice, the groomer? Who could do it? And why now?

"I had to name check you Hunter, because when I saw you walk up to the door, I thought they got you too."

Hunter blushed. The weight of his own figure became quite apparent. A self conscious hand reached towards his middle and rested upon a...
114.title: New Choice: It's over Rover

12.content:
Colleen stirred awake, looking at the blue-gray metal ceiling and letting her mind wander as she emerged slowly from sleep.

It had been almost two years now since the Rovers were no longer the 'secret' super heroes they'd been. Not that they didn't still save the world, but being publicly known around the globe and all the changes that had ensued since they became fully known to the public... it was still a bit much to consider.

Colleen looked at the clock and groaned. The new recruits would be expecting her in a couple hours for their training. And that was another thing, with the Rovers so well known, their ranks were swelling with new recruits almost by the day. The original team, which Colleen was part of, where still going on missions of the toughest and most challenging quality on occasion. However, most of the time they had these days was spent teaching younger and more fresh recruits how to save the world.

The humanoid collie groggily got out of bed, pushing her bush of brown fur/hair our of her face as she made her way to the bathroom to get showered and dressed.

Little did she know that today was going to be different from any other.

121.content:
Colleen made her way to the mirror with bleary eyed sluggishness. Typical for a Monday morning, which was odd considering it was Friday. Once in the bathroom she turned to face the mirror, regretting what she forced herself to see immediately.

Colleen have never been a 'morning dog' by any means but recently things just seemed to get worse. Due to the onset of age the face that stared back at Colleen was a bit of a fright. She wasn't really old old, but she had that distinct look of 'middle age' that was enhanced by baggy eyes, faint wrinkles on her cheeks, and a bit of 'sag' in places she didn't want to think about. Most went away after her morning routine to perk herself up, but it was the initial scare of seeing all that along with her unruly bed head of fur that made the female wince every morning when she looked in the mirror.

Pulling open the cabinet she got out the usual necessities and proceeded through her automatic actions as she brushed her teeth, combed her fur, applied a moderate dose of anti-flea and tick powder (it was impolite to scratch in public after all), and made herself ready. Once done Colleen still had bleary somewhat bloodshot eyes, but the other effects were less noticeable at least.

As she returned to her room to dress, Colleen sighed, she knew getting older was a part of life, but it still frustrated her to know a few more years and missions might not be possible, a decade or two and she wouldn't even be able to show her routines to students, she'd be stuck behind a desk teaching 'theory'. Not to mention her chances of winning the clueless Hunter over were slipping away day by day. Cano-sapians might have aged at near human levels, but it was small consolation. Getting older might have been a thing she could stand if she could find someway to undo the unpleasant side effects of her looks deteriorating at least.

As Colleen slipped on her boots and buckled her belt, she gave one last check in the mirror. With a final sigh she stepped out the door...

"SURPRISE!"

Whether it was Colleens fast thinking or her aging reflexes that saved Hunter from getting a boot to the stomach was something best left a mystery. The fact of the matter was Colleen stood there in shock as confetti thrown by the golden Labrador rained down over both of them.

"What's all this then?" Colleen blinked as she looked around, both Exile and Blitz stood nearby looking pleasantly smug.

"It is, how you say, big surprise," Exile smiled in his typical thick Russian accent, "Comrade Hunter has quite the treat in store." The blue and white furred huskie Colleen had long known looked just as strong as ever, though these days Exile was sporting a touch more of a paunch than before.

"Hey come on Exile," Hunter chuckled gently bumping his fist on the huskies shoulder playfully, "We agreed I'd get to tell her." The leader of the Rovers was looking as good as ever. Though if one were to look very closely, Hunters fur was starting to gray just slightly around his temples.

"I still don't see why you get to," Blitz remarked, rolling his eyes, "I should be the one to tell her." The dobermans thick German accent rolled off his tong with the usual arrogance Colleen had come to expect. While still as physically fit as ever, Blitz was also showing his age with a few more wrinkles around his eyes and cheeks, though he was far too vane to ever really 'show' them, preferring to cover such things with a dab of makeup on his fur.

"And you are...?" Colleen had to hide a smirk as Blitz face-palmed at her continued running gag of forgetting his name.

"Well I get to tell her because I'm the one who bought the tickets," hunter replied with a note of finality.

"Tickets?" Colleen asked curiously, "Tickets for what? Come on, tell me Hunty-wunty."

The golden chuckled again and brandished the printed stubs of paper for Colleen, "Here you go. Round trip tickets for a two month long stay at the latest tropical resort, Paradise Island."

"No way," Colleen gaped, "You mean that place that's opening up on an exclusive south seas island this week? The one that's been in the newspapers for almost a year promising a vacation of ones dreams?"

"That's the one," Hunter smiled, "I've been saving up all year for you. Trust me Colleen, you've earned it.

"Oh Hunter, this is so sweat of you," she smiled taking the tickets, "But I'd hate to leave you out."

"Not to worry," Hunter nodded, "We'll be joining you, but just for the last couple weeks or so. So you get six weeks on your own to have fun and then we'll join you for two more so we can all have fun together."

"Aw Hunter," Colleen smiled and then looked at the tickets in surprise, "These are for tomorrow."

"Yep," Hunter smiled, "Better get packing. Don't worry, we'll handle your classes while you're away. You go and have fun. We'll join you before long."

Colleen couldn't help it and gave Hunter a quick kiss on the cheek, "Thank you boys." She smiled as Hunter blushed and turned back around into her room to being the difficult decision of what exactly to pack.



So, does Colleen make it to the island safely or does something else happen to her?

1212.content:
The sun on her fur... The sound of waves... the salty smell on the breeze...

         These were the first things that came to Colleens mind as she lay on her back clawing her way out of the deep blackness that only unconsciousness could bring. An attempt to move left her gasping in pain as bruises and muscle aches resounded through her whole body.

Something had happened. Something...

         The crash of thunder... the flash of lightning... the smell of smoke...

         "Mayday! Mayday! This is Number 247! Repeat, this is Number 247 on route to Paradise Island! We've taken a direct hit from a bolt of Lightning! Instruments are fried! Systems failing! Coordinates are-"

         An explosion, blinding pain, the sensation of falling...

         Cold, smothering water...

         Colleen gasped as her eyes shot open and immediately she slammed them shut again in pain against the bright light. The memories were coming back. A tropical storm had sprung up in their path, rather than go around the pilot had assumed it wasn't a threat, but it had worsened as they approached, and developed into a full-on typhoon by the time they were in the thick of things. One of the engines was struck, the plane went down...

         It was with some reluctance Colleen tried to open her eyes again, the bright light still threatening to blind her. Moving her hand to shield her eyes felt like lifting a ten ton weight. Still she slowly did so and peaked out at her surroundings. Slowly the image of a pristine white beach came into view.

         It was marred only by pieces of wreckage from the plane.

         Again Colleen gasped and tried to move. The pilot! She'd almost forgotten. She was a Rover she had to find him and save him if she could. Standing proved difficult as every inch of her body ached and her left leg probably had a fracture. Still she forced herself up to look at the scene.

         It wasn't good.

         From what could be seen of the crushed trees and scattered wreckage the plane had almost missed the island entirely. She could see the path carved through the forest where it had come down, snapping trees and carving a deep furrow through the soil and sand. Bits of the plane were scattered all over, but the majority was gone. Given the way the trees had been flung they'd started to come down on the island, which meant...

         Colleen turned towards the ocean and felt a sinking feeling in her stomach. She'd been lucky, the plane had crashed and she'd been thrown from the wreck, but the pilot and plane had continued on, plowing nose first into the sea. No doubt the plane was lying at the bottom of the ocean right now. And given how much of the furrow had been washed away by the tide and the clear skies overhead, even if she'd been in any condition to make a dive there'd be almost no chance of finding anyone alive down there.

         All Colleen could do was mutter a quick but solemn prayer to the pilot and give thanks for her own survival.

         Of course another problem immediately became evident. With the plane swallowed by the sea she had no radio to call for help, and unless a message got out in time it would be a while before the crash sight was located.

         "Well as long as I don't find a boat marked the S.S.Minnow or find the bones of someone in a red shirt and white hat I should be ok," Colleen tried to joke to keep her spirits up but really the whole thing was more than a little sobering. "Well if there's one thing all those survival training classes have taught me, it's the first thing to do is build a fire. Ok technically it's not to panic and make a signal, but I think I'm beyond panicking and the wreckage, though scattered, is fairly visible."

         Fortunately there were the smoldering remains of part of the jet engine nearby, and though it had long since stopped and was mostly drained of furl, a small fire still burned in the corner of it which she was able to used to light some branches and build a bonfire on the beach. If she was going to survive until rescue it was a start at least. But already something felt strange about the island. Something she couldn't quite pin down right off.

Option One: She's not alone, there's a rustling in the bushes. Strange anthro creatures are natives of the island and believe she is a goddess descended from the heavens.

Option Two: Something smells funny about the burning branches and sand. They don't seem right. A sniff and a taste reveals the sand is pure sugar and the branches are beef jerky. Everything on the island appears to be made out of food of some form or another.

Option Three: Something completely different.

Just what she needed, islanders, but surprisingly they speak Japanese and not their own language. Sad part is, she doesn't speak it, she only knew, because she knows that "or" means "matawa". So she tried to ask if any of them miraculousy spoke English.

(B) Or you can beg to be let go, but you have to come to our village and see what the chief thinks.

122.content:
Colleen washed and brushed as usual and donned the 'casual' Rovers uniform of black pants and boots with a green T-shirt. Just as she was about to leave her quarters though, a message came over the intercom which she promptly answered.

"Colleen here," she replied in her usual British accent, "What's up?"

"Colleen?" Came the male voice over the com, "This is Roger down in the tech lab. We've got a small situation down here." A crackling explosion came over the intercom, "Actually make that a large problem. One of our expariments has gone nuts and we need someone to get down here and stop it."

"I'm on my way."

Just a minute later Colleen arrived at the lab and promptly had to duck as a large blast of energy short over her head. In the center of the room a large laser cannon type device was spinning crazily, firing randomly in any direction it could spin. Ducking behind a nearby table, Colleen found the tech she's spoken to, Roger, a Whippet canine.

"What is that thing?" Colleen asked as she tried to make sense of the machines spasms.

"Suffice it to say, it's a device that radiates a new type of energy we recently discovered," Roger replied, "As you can see, we needed someone with your agility to get past it and pull the plug." Roger indicated the far side of the machine where a large black plud lead from the machine to a wall outlet. "Please just pull it if you can, that machine is the result of almost a decade of research."

"Don't get your pocket protector in a pinch," Coleen smiled, "I can handle it."

Colleen watched the machines movements for a moment and noted how fast it took to discharge and it's rotation speed. While the shots seemed random, there was a shifting pattern she was able to descern. After getting it down, Colleen lept from behind the desk, spinning through the air, and landing in a temporarily safe spot. From there the dance of danger was on as she spun, twisted and dove through the beams towards the plug.

Finally she reached it and pulled as hard as she could, but it took a moment longer than anticipated and right as the plug came free, the final discharge from the gun caught Colleen full in the backside and she feel to the ground, a wisp of smoke curling from her prone body while inside her something began to change.
122.title: Lasers Phase-Her

Upon arriving back to said HQ though Blitz saw one of the other Rovers in the garage. And not to anthro Doberman's surprise it was in fact....
1311211.title: Testing His Strength

choices: Blitz is able to make it through the door by crouching.
Blitz can only make it through the door by crawling!
Blitz is so big he can't even make it through the door!
Blitz feels something strange... a tingle runs through his body...
13112111.content:
Blitz narrowed his eyes as he tried to make out who it was who was in the garage. Whoever it was, it definitely wasn't Shag given that they were wearing armor, but that was all he could make out and he didn't want to risk embarrassing himself by driving straight into something because he'd been distracted. That would have completely ruined the dramatic reveal he was planning. He turned his attention back to parking, and once he was satisfied, he switched off the ignition and took another look.

"Ah. Snowball." He smirked deviously. Perfect. Exile had turned to watch as he had driven in, and he could see his completely shocked expression in wonderful detail. Judging by the dull green glow of his eyes, he had 'activated' his night-vision. Unable to keep himself from grinning madly, he reached open and pushed the door open, stepping out of the car. His grin only grew even wider when he saw Exile stagger back, bracing himself against the car. As he stood to his full height, drinking in Exile having to crane his neck back to look up at him, he realized just how cramped he had actually been in that car. Raising an arm and flexing his bicep smugly, he spoke. "Hey there, Snowball! Check me out!" He smirked. As he spoke, his voice echoing around the garage, he realized how much deeper his voice was, how powerful it was, how sexy it was.

"Blitz!" The Husky yelped. "You... you're huge! You're massive! How did you get so big?!" He asked.

Blitz grinned as he knelt down and shoved a hand into the car. "I'm so glad you asked that. It's all thanks to this little baby here!" He proclaimed, triumphantly holding the tank aloft. It looked comparatively tiny in his hand, his thick fingers curled around its metal shell.

Exile gently pushed himself off the car and tentatively walked forwards, eying the tank suspiciously. "That little thing made you big?" He asked, his skepticism obvious. He nodded enthusiastically.

"Ja! It's incredible, isn't it? I'm so big!" He smirked cockily. He just couldn't help it, the thrill, the rush, the power was too intense to not enjoy it so much!

Exile was silent for a few long moments, as he looked over the towering Doberman who looked as if he could bench press an 18-wheeler. He slowly nodded, his voice wavering. "Da. It is quite... impressive." He conceded, his jaw slightly agape. "How... how did you... well, um, grow?" He asked, to which Blitz moved to the tank so that he could see the valve.

"All I did was take in a bit of the air, and I was growing bigger and stronger!" He grinned widely, to which Exile gaped up at him.

"So... you, you just breathed in random gas from a weird tank you found... where did you find this thing anyway?" He asked in bewilderment.

Blitz grinned down at him sheepishly as he rubbed the back of his head, his bicep audibly straining his suit as he did so. It was as glorious as it was bizarre to experience. "Okay, ja, I guess it does sound kind of weird when you say it like that. But, it had all these buttons on it, so I guessed it was some medical thing or something. I found it in a barn when I ended up lost. I thought it would calm me down!" He explained, to which Exile shook his head.

"Okay, so, you breathe a gas that makes you bigger because you got lost and stumbled on some barn? Why would you think it was medical?" He asked, to which Blitz retorted.

"Look, there were all sorts of gadgetry and gizmos there, it made sense when I was looking at it!" He reasoned. Exile blinked, furrowing his brow in confusion.

"There were lots of things like that?" He asked, prompting Blitz to nod vigorously.

"Ja! There were little computers and some workout stuff too!" He said, to which Exile let out a breath as he paced back and forth.

"Blitz, I think we should go and see Professor Hubert, who knows what that could be, or what it might do to you." He said, a tinge of concern in his voice.

"We already know what it does, it makes you bigger and stronger!" He replied excitedly.

"Da, but what if it does something else? This could be dangerous Blitz. Besides, we need to know what the dealio with the rest of those things you mentioned is too." He pointed out. Blitz bit his lip, unable to come up with a counter-argument.

He brought a hand up to his muzzle, shifting in place. "Ah, I guess you're right. Do we go and tell him now? Do we wait? What do we do?" He asked. Exile thought on it for a moment before reaching a decision.

"I say we go now. If there is anything bad happening, the sooner we know, the better." Unable to find a fault in that logic, he nodded.

"Alright, let's go." He said. He was considering stepping over the car to really help emphasize his new height, but decided against it, given that Exile was standing so close.

"Okay, and you should bring that tank along too. The Professor might want to test it for things." He suggested, to which Blitz simply looked down at him. It was such a strange thing to be looking so far down just to look your comrades in the eyes after so long of being pretty much the same height as them.

"Uh, I'm holding it in my hand, I'm not planning on letting this thing go any time soon." He smirked. Exile shook his head.

"Da, da, I meant, ah, it does not matter. Come, we should go and find Professor Hubert." He said, turning to the door. Blitz followed him, but quickly realized he had to slow his walk quite considerably, given that his greatly increased height also granted him a significantly longer stride. Exile practically had to jog just to keep up with him.
13112111.title: Back to Headquarters

choices: Professor Hubert is there. Time to start looking into this.
Professor Hubert isn't there, but someone else is!
They're about to go in when Blitz's stomach growls.
131121112.content:
As the pair came to the door, it was only then that they realized just how tall Blitz really was now. Simply standing normally, the door barely reached the bottom of his broad chest, his firm pectorals barely meeting the top of the frame, and given how all the rooms and doors had been made larger than most properties, it only made it all the more obvious. Exile could only stare for a few moments in dumbfounded shock before he half-babbled out a string of awed comments.

"I... I can't believe it! You're bigger than the doors! These things can let Shag walk about fine, and there you are! You can't even fit through the doors!" He gasped out, staring up the titan of a Doberman with wide eyes. Blitz couldn't help but raise an arm and flex as he smirked down at him. The whole feeling of being too tall for the doors was just too wonderful to pass up the opportunity to show it off at every chance he got.

"Ja, I'm huge!" He beamed gleefully, showing off his indestructible fangs slightly.

The Husky nodded mutely, evidently shaken by the realization. He averted his gaze for a minute before he quietly said. "Let us go find the Professor, Da?" Blitz nodded in agreement.

"Ja, sounds good. You go first. I'll need to, heh, squeeze my way through." He replied, obviously relishing how his new size changed the way he interacted with something as simple as a door. Exile promptly stepped through, turning to face Blitz once he was in the hall.

Blitz flashed a grin at him as he crouched down, his massive frame shifting and moving with surprising grace as his armor creaked and groaned alarmingly as his powerful frame stretched against it. He reached a beefy arm through and guided his head through, taking care to avoid smacking into anything, although he couldn't keep his ears from hitting the frame, forcing them to flatten before he pulled through, his ears popping back up. He tentatively shifted himself so that his cannonball shoulders could be eased through, after which, he carefully moved his other arm through.

It was at this point that he realized an issue he hadn't anticipated. His snout was already nearly pressed into the opposite wall. With a sharp intake of breath through clenched teeth, he began to rotate his enormous frame as best he could, so that he was at a more diagonal angle, allowing him to slowly pull himself forwards, dragging his thick legs through. After a few moments of dragging himself forwards and deep, panting breaths that ruffled Exile's fur, he managed to haul himself into the hallway. Bringing his muscular arms under his mighty chest, he pushed himself up, breathing a sigh of relief as he realized that the halls were tall enough to accommodate him. Even if it was only just.

"Right! There we are, now let's go find Professor Hubert, hmm?" He suggested, unable to keep himself from grinning widely at Exile's stunned expression. Exile nodded weakly, ducking past his muscular legs to get in front of him and begin leading him down to the labs. As they began to make their way through the halls, Exile couldn't help but wonder at how strong Blitz must be now.

Barring Shag, he was the strongest member of the team. He could remember embracing Blitz with a bear hug and hearing every single joint in his torso crack in what was admittedly, a rather amusing manner, despite the slightly grotesque occurrence. He could lift dozens upon dozens of tons above his head without breaking a sweat when he tried and thinking about it, he realized that he wasn't actually sure what his real upper limit was. Typically, the limiting factor in using his strength was how tough the object was. He could hold a door closed if someone wanted to get through, but they could still make progress. If he pushed any harder, the door would simply bend under his touch like tissue paper. But now? Now he might have a new contender. It was... such a strange feeling. They were all incredibly strong, but he was the second strongest. For Blitz to suddenly become so huge? It was... weird.

He shook his head and shoved those thoughts to the back of his mind. There would be time for that later, for now he had to find Professor Hubert. Who knew what this could be doing to Blitz right now? Of course, it could be doing him no harm and even improving him in ways that he couldn't even think of at this point, but it could also be slowly damaging him and destroying his body from the inside out while everything seemed perfectly okay. He couldn't take that chance, he just couldn't. After Blitz had grown so much as a person... His thoughts trailed off as he smirked at his choice of words. It was true though, he couldn't just stand by when something could be seriously wrong. And so, off to Professor Hubert it was. As they continued through the corridors, thankfully without encountering anyone else, they came to the Laboratory, their destination clearly marked above the door with an impressively official sign above the door.
131121112.title: Blitz can only make it through the door by craw...

choices: see how strong he was now after the growth.
get some food. He was hungry.
Find the others. He wanted to show off his size.
Get some rest, he was feeling woozy for some reason...
1311211121.content:
Blitz and Exile walked into the laboratory and saw Professor Hubert standing off over in a corner of the room as he appeared to be focused on something under a microscope. And so in a attempt to get the older dogs attention Exile cleared his throat when he called out, "Uh, Professor. It seems we have situation we must be dealing with."

After saying this the husky saw the anthro dog lift his head and move away from his microscope while he replied, "Ah Exile, now what seems to be the problem...." And once the usky saw the other dog saw how huge Blitz had become he sw the older dog fix his glasses as he added on with, "O-Oh, I see. This is quite the problem indeed." He then began to walk up to them and continued with, "Now Blitz tell me, how did this happen to you?"

"Well you see Professor, I found htis empty barn and came across this air pump here. And when I sunked in the air I somehow find myself growing bigger." The anthro Doberman expalined, to which he showed the older dog the air pump.

and so both Evile and Blitz watched as Professor Hubert walk up to the large hand of massive anthro dog as he took a look at the air pump. And while he did this he told them, "Oh, I see. Hmm, very perplexing." He then took it out of Blitz's hand and carried it over to a nearby table. And upon doing so he looked back them from over his shoulder and added, "This might take me a while to learn how this works. So why don't you two wait outside for a bit. And if I find anything I'll come and get you."

Upon hearing this both Rovers nodded their heads and hten left the laboratory. But once they did this though Blitz wanted to....
1311211121.title: Running Some Tests

choices: use the air pump on himself. He'd show Blitz who was the strongest.
seek advice from someone. Maybe Hunter could help?
Find the barn where the pump came from, the data should be in Blitz's car.
13112111211.content:
Blitz and Exile walked down the hallway after leaving the Professor's lab and both of them knew that if there was something seriously wrong with the air pump the older anthro dog could most certainly find out what that might be. But as they walked down the hall the huge Doberman had an idea come to his head as he looked down at Exile and suggested, "Hey Snowball, why don't we go see how strong am I now wile we wait for the Professor to tell us what he found out in the air pump?"

"Um I'm not sure about that, comrade. We don't want to disturb the others while they're sleeping." Exile protested, which caused Blitz to slightly groan out in annoyance.

After doing this he then continued ot walk down the hallway when he said, "Fine, have it your way. But I'm going to go see how strong am I. and I promise I won't wake the others up."

-----------

Exile watched as his now huge comrade walked down the hallway until he reached the vehicle bay again. This peaked the husky's interest as he slowly followed behind the Doberman and looked on and let out a gasp upon seeing the other anthro dog easily lift one of the Rovers vehicles with both of his hands and over his head while in a crouching position. This gave the anthro husky a very god view of the huge anthro dog's wide and muscled back along with his short tail which was wagging like crazy above his two large, muscled, and firm butt-cheeks which caused the husky to blush a little.

However, his staring was quickly broken away from Blitz when he heard Professor Hubert's voice when he said, "Ah Exile, I'm glad I found you."

This caused the anthro husky to turn around look at the approaching anthro dog as he asked, "Oh, Professor. did you find what caused Blitz to get so big?"

"No, I'm afraid I didn't. From what I could tell there's nothing but air in there. So I plan on doing some more tests to see if that might bring me better results." Hubert explained, before he looked into the vehicle bay and saw what Blitz was doing. And upon doing so one of Exile's ears twitched when he heard the older dog muttered to himself, Wow, that's quite impressive strength indeed."

Hearing this only caused the husky's eyebrow to narrow while he let out a slight growl of annoyance. This caused him to mentally gasp as he realized that he was in fact jealous of Blitz's new increase in size. But while the Professor walked away and up to Blitz to most likely tell him about his findings an idea popped into the anthro husky's head. That being that he could go into the lab and use the air pump on himself. That way he would be not only the second strongest on the team again, but maybe even the strongest Rover ever. However, he could also look for advice from one of his teammates as well. That could at least help him cool down. And so after thinking it over Exile decided to.....
13112111211.title: Green With Envy

choices: "Hunter, I need your help, I... I need your advice. Can I come in?"
"Hunter, comrade, there is something I have to ask you about."
131121112112.content:
The thought of reclaiming his position of the second physically strongest Rover on the team, or even becoming the strongest Rover on the team, even more powerful than Shag, was an enticing thought indeed, especially when he could see how easily Blitz could hoist that vehicle - which had to clock in at least a couple of tons with all of the armour and equipment. However, as he slid his eyes closed and took a deep, steadying breath, he quashed the idea. He had a host of powers with his eyes - heat, freezing, night-vision. His strength was far from his only power, and far from his only asset at that; he was a brilliant mechanic. Engineering had always come naturally to him, the mathematics and physics lining up in beautiful, perfect order. The physics of his powers were something he hadn't learned much about, but Professor Hubert and the Master were much more aware of that. Besides which, an understanding of the physics of their powers were not essential to their success in the field, at least on a theoretical level. He was far more of a practically-minded individual, and he could be of tremendous help on the field because of it. He didn't need to be the strongest Rover on the team, no matter how much of a blow it was to his ego.

But, then again, the thrill of such extreme strength was undeniable - the ability to perform feats of strength that those around you could not, and those that verged on the violation of physics itself were thrilling beyond description. The feel of his muscles burning as the obstacle surrendered to his sheer power was a feeling that always left him slightly giddy, and the feeling of an obstacle surrendering to his might without his muscles burning, for something to require no effort in the first place, it was a rush like no other.

He blinked, taking in a sharp breath. He froze as he was struck by the realisation that he was falling to the temptation. He clenched his teeth, shaking his head vigorously. He had to distract himself from all of this somehow. He had to think of something that could firmly keep his mind off the idea of using that tank, except nothing came to mind. Every option available to him either involved physical activity which would no doubt lead him down the path of longing for such exceptional size and strength, or wouldn't require enough of his attention to reliably keep him resisting the temptation. As much as he wanted it, his conscious mind practically screamed at him to not risk it - he had no idea of the possible consequences, and even if it did turn out to be completely harmless, he would much rather not take the risk. Of course, if it was completely harmless...

He shook his head again, growling softly. He turned and slipped through the door, unwilling to stay any longer, lest his willpower give out completely. He had to think of something... or maybe... someone. Talking about his thoughts could help convince his less rational side to hold off on simply charging into the laboratory and inhaling a few litres of air right there and then. As much as he hadn't wanted to wake the others up, he needed to talk with someone about this. Considering the alternative was using the tank, it was a simple choice... or... it would have been, if the temptation wasn't there. It would be so easy to reclaim his position, or to even surpass it...

He ran a paw over his muzzle, setting off down the hall. Obviously, Blitz was completely out of the question, given that a mere glance at him was enough to send his mind racing with all sorts of thrills and exciting thoughts. The same held true for Professor Hubert - the dog was truly brilliant, and while he was sure he could help talk him through his irrational desires, he didn't dare take the risk. The Master, again, no, he couldn't talk with him. If Professor Hubert hadn't informed him already, then he'd no doubt want to investigate the tank further, and that might involve Blitz. Shag... no, no! Given that he was the strongest... well, second strongest now, talking with him would simply be stupid, it'd be the exact same, for all intents and purposes, as talking to Blitz. So, that only left Colleen and Hunter, and given that everyone else was still sleeping, well... Colleen needed her 'beauty sleep'. Hunter it was then.

It wasn't as if he didn't enjoy the Retriever mix's company. Hardly, on the contrary, he'd have to say he did enjoy Hunter's company. As... eccentric as he could be, he was a genuinely capable leader when the situation called for it, not to mention that he was also incredibly personable. Always willing to lend an ear or a paw, if you ever had a problem, Hunter would drop whatever he was doing and immediately see to helping you out. He was exactly the person he'd need in a situation like this. Setting off with newfound purpose, he made his way through the hallways towards their quarters.

As he walked through the smooth, steel corridors, his boots thumping rhythmically on the hard floor, he distracted himself by taking in the view on the way. He'd walked through these halls more times than he could count. Most of the time it had been for mundane reasons, simply moving from point A to point B for whatever reason he'd needed to, but sometimes it had been for much more intense reasons: Parvo had deployed Cano-mutants again; World Leaders were under threat and their own security services wanted to cover all bases; the very security of the world was under threat. While their missions were still demanding both physically and mentally, and at times, psychologically, they had mercifully become less frequent with Parvo and other major players becoming much more known to the world - with their element of surprise gone, the world could adjust and begin formulating plans of action. He brought a paw to the underside of his muzzle, rubbing it thoughtfully as he mused on that. Parvo would remain a threat until he was no longer here... as morbid as that was, on many levels. Though, maybe, just maybe, the world could be safe one day. There could be a world where the Rovers were there as an option, not as a necessity. A wistful smile crossed his muzzle at the thought.

Continuing down the hall, his mind wandered off to their many missions over the years, and how they had changed with the world. They had been through so many trials and tribulations and so many fights, far more than he cared for. He snarled furiously as he ducked beneath the St. Bernard's punch - which probably could have sent a tank flying across a six-lane highway - and rushed up with a savage uppercut. The cano-mutant let out a garbled howl of pain as it staggered back. It attempted to defend it's bulky torso with its muscular arms but he didn't do for the easy hit. The gamble paid off, and his ears were blasted by a scream of agony as its kneecap was smashed with enough force to shatter concrete. Only the enhanced anatomy of a cano-mutant saved the dog from being crippled. As its great bulk dropped with an almighty crash, he grabbed it by the shoulders - as intimidating as it would be to hold him aloft by the throat, he didn't want to kill him - and hauled him up, smashing him through the railing as if it were made of gram crackers and holding him there. His muzzle twisted into a dark scowl as the St. Bernard realised what he was being held over. Of course, he had no intent of ever dropping him into concentrated ammonia, but he didn't know that judging by the wide-eyed look of terror he was giving him. He could feel the moment it stopped fighting out of an attempt to get to safety, and the moment it started fighting out of pure, unadulterated panic, a primal, instinctual fear. With a snarl, he quickly threw the thing back onto the platform, where it immediately scrambled away from him, backing up against the opposite railing and cowering. He looked at it for a moment, back to the tank, and back at him again. With the message clear, he moved on. There were still people to save.

He sighed as he pulled himself out of his memories. Their missions had changed in many ways, yet stayed the same in others. However, another thing that had changed with time was the team itself, and without doubt, certainly for the better. Hunter had grown from a ditzy, at times almost foolish goofball who had fallen into a leadership role, to a capable, rational leader. Colleen's temper had calmed with time and training, and Blitz's cockiness had matured from foolhardiness to cautious confidence. Shag was still somewhat of a coward, but he'd become a lot less bumbling. Muzzle... well, Muzzle was still a force of nature who could rip almost anything apart effortlessly. He recalled Blitz openly wondering if he had super strength or super strong teeth and claws, or both, and he'd been hard pressed to argue against that thought. He shook his head, Muzzle didn't quite count, even if he was part of the team. As he finished the list of his team mates, he realised that *he* must have changed with them... how had he changed? His brow furrowed as he considered his own changes - it was always harder to figure out how you'd changed compared to others. He supposed that since starting, he could say with a reasonable degree of certainty that he had become more world-wise. Figures of speech made more sense to him now, as did a lot of the world in general... He'd matured? He would have said that he was mature to begin with, he was an adult after all. Of course, self-reflection isn't the easiest thing in the world. The very second he'd finished saying that in his head, however, he noticed Hunter's room, pausing in his tracks.

Pushing his thoughts aside, he stepped forward, knocking gently. No reply, he knocked harder, wincing at the noise. As he raised his paw again, his ears twitched at a soft sound. Stepping back, the door opened, revealing Hunter, clad in pyjamas - much like his own, except green. "Exile! Hey buddy, what's up?" Hunter asked, his tone quiet but enthusiastic.
131121112112.title: seek advice from someone. Maybe Hunter could help?

both of us use the air pump at the same time."
1311211121122.content:
Exile rubbed the back of his neck with his right hand when he moved his gaze somewhat off to the side when he replied to the anthro golden retriever, "Hunter, comrade, there is something I have to ask you about."

"Woah, no need to be nervous Exile. If have something to ask me then by all means just ask me." Hunter reassured his friend, to which the anthro husky felt his friend place a hand onto his right shoulder in comfort.

After the leader of the Rovers had done this Exile couldn't help but to let out a heavy sigh before he looked back at him and asked, "Well, how would you react to an item that could um how you say, does the changing of you?"

"What exactly do you mean, Exile?" Huynter asked, while he tilted his head to the right in slight confusion.

"Erm well I know this will be sounding like the crazy talk. But comrade Blitz seemed to have found a pump that made him not only bigger, but much stronger too." The blue and white furred anthro dog explained as best as he oculd.

SAdly though the husky saw the other buff dog let out a chuckle before he replied, "Exile, buddy, I highly doubt there's something that could change someone like much or in that way."

However, even he himself did have doubts of such a thing being real when he first saw Blitz at his bigger size when he returned to the base about or hour ago. And within a few minute both Rovers arrived at the large vhicle bay to which Exile mentally pointed out that the door was still opened. Which he knew meant that both Blitz and Professor Hubert must of been inside there as the older must of still been running test of the semi giant doberman.

And so Exile made sure that both he and Hunter slowed down to just a walking pace until they reached the opened the doorway. Once there the husky then extended towards the massive doberman and looked at Hunter while he remarked, "Here, see for yourself comrade Hunter."

So the heavily muscled husky watched as the godlen retriever looked into the room. And as he did this he was not surprised when he saw Hunter's eyes widen in pure shock while he also let out a gasp of surprise and took a step back. However, the leader of the Road Rovers quickly recovered from his shock as Exile saw him look back in his direction as he aslo cleared his throat and said, "Well, I can see why you'd ask me the quesiton you did earlier."

Feeling a smirk ocming on from proving to his friend that what he had said was true Exile crossed his huge arms in front of his huge pecs as he commented, "I'm glad that you believe me comrade." Though the husky's confident look quickly turned to that of confusion as he saw the golden retriever's eyes were glued on the much large Blitz. Who at least by the look on his face that was what the husky assumed since he too found himself staring at his changed friend as well. And so he waved a hand in front of his friend's face and added, "Comrade? Are you still with me?"

"Huh? Oh yeah, yeah, sorry about that Exile." Hunter let out, as he let out a light chuckle and then rubbed the back of his own neck with his left hand. Though the husky couldn't help but notice a twinkle in his friend's eyes as he continued with, "So you wouldn't happen to know where this air pump is do you?"

"Yes...I do? Why do you want to do see it?" Exile asked, while he tried to figure out what his friend wanted to do. But once he saw Hunter give him a nod in response to his question the husky sighed in defeat and then began to walk towards the lab while he went on with, "Very well. Follow me comrade."

--------------

After about ten minutes of quietly walking down the hallways both Road Rovers arrived at the lab. And once both had opened hte door and walked into it Exile saw Hunter give him a confsued look as he asked, "What, that's the air pimp that made Blitz so big? It doesn't look any different a normal air pump."

"Yes I know, it is very strange. Even Professor Hubert is unsure how it actually works." Exile confessed, while they walked up to it. He then felt that urge to use the item to get back to his status of the strongest Rover Road again as he swallowed a lump in his throat and looked over at Hunter and kept on going, "So what do we do now comrade?"

Before answering the husky saw his friend cross his arms over his own impressive chest as he suggested, "Well to be honest even though it worked on Blitz, we have n oidea if it'll work on us or not. So I think we should test it out by having......
1311211121122.title: Seeking Advice

132.content: Blitz found an old wishing well. "Load of lies, this thing" muttered Blitz. He never had been one to believe in magic, wishes or nonsense like that. Still, he had a coin on his person, so he figured "why not?" Standing by the wishing well (unaware of its real power), he said "I wish..."
132.title: Make a wish.

14.content: Alright, what happens to Exile?
14.title: The Siberian's story.

choices: He was more fat than the last night.
142.content:
Why Budapest? He was a famous Siberian Husky, Exile fumed to himself, and a powerful one. Budapest was an awful city where Exile had been given an awful job as a watch dog for a defense contracting firm for the United States. The language was gibberish to Exile, who realized almost immediately that Hungarian wasn't a slavic language, almost any of which Exile could understand and draw a basic meaning from. The people in his firm, mercifully, spoke in English to one another.
         Exile had been briefed by the Master about hissudden relocation from his pastoral home in Siberia before he had been shipped here to Budapest: apparently, some moron in the Department of Justice in America had forgotten to redact his name in a classified memorandum that had somehow, probably through leaking, managed to get into the hands of the American press. And the location of his home had been leaked as well.
         Exile supposed that things could have been worse. He could have been shipped to Somalia or some other third-world nation. The people of Budapest were a friendly and generous lot, especially with food, Exile noticed. Exile chuckled, he wished he could have a taste of the local cuisine. And with that happy thought, Exile noticed the cleaning lady who was frequenlty the joy of his day, Ana. She was a stout, almost motherly figure in appearance and demeanor. She would fuss over Exile in a way that he sincerely missed. Although she never seemed to leave, Exile knew that at some point she must.
         Exile deduced this from a small, square package Ana held in her arms. But as Ana approached, Exile realized that Ana's package was larger than he anticipated. And the package smelled deeply of the greasy, calorie-heavy food that had made stomach of the security guard who sat at the front desk with Alex form a generous fold when the man sat.
         Officer Viktor Ferfi was a short, pale, dirty-blond-haired man with greasy skin and an ever-sweaty body. Although his stench repelled Exile, the food that the man kept on himself was enough to draw Exile back. The man was also nice enough; and even though he wasn't technically allowed to do so, he kept a bag of dog food and a bowl behind the desk where he sat and let Exile eat whenever and whatever he wanted, including some of the man's food.
         Ana had now strolled up to Viktor for some reason and had given him the box, with a chocolate cake inside. Viktor seemed delighted, but said that he was full still from lunch. Exile sensed that the two loved each other, given the amount of gifts the two exchanged between themselves. Exile quickly got bored by the duo's sentimental coversations and went back to eating his food quietly.
         After he had finished his food and Ana had left, Viktor refilled Exile's bowl and went back to work, occassionally eating a bite or two of his piece of cake before it was time for him to leave. Exile finished his bowl of food just before the time Viktor usually left. So after Viktor had refilled his bowl, Exile contentedly wagged. But Viktor, asde from the usual pat on the head before he left, cut Exile a very liberal slice of cake and fed the dog a quarter of the cake. When Exile devoured the piece, Viktor smiled, whispered about Exile's healthy appetite, cut Exile another small piece, and left.
         Within minutes, however, Exile seemed woozy before he lay down and fell asleep. And when he awokeâ€¦

1521.content:
Darkness was pressing against Muzzle's eyes when he rose to consciousness. He tried to open his eyes, but he found them forced shut. This was puzzling. The last thing he remembered was going to sleep with everyone else. Also, his straitjacket, the thing that restrained him from attacking others, was off, but he was bound with his limbs splayed out. In addition, he felt something pushed in his mouth, thought he couldn't immediately identify it.

Muzzle, alarmed and angered by this new position, struggled fruitlessly against his bonds. As he was trying to escape, the sound of a distant door opened and he froze. There were quiet footsteps, as a whispering group drew close to the dog. Muzzle tried to hear what they wer saying, but they were effectively quiet and, when they silenced themselves, another, more pronounced sound pounded against his ears and he began to feel something going into his maw.

The sound was...
1521.title: Muzzle Bound

1522.content: Well, is there anyone else that can be used?
1522.title: Is there anyone else?

15221.content:
There are the Space Rovers who travel the galaxy in a ship that's something of a take on the Enterprise in the shape of a dog in mid leap catching a Frisbee, the 'saucer section' can even detach for greater maneuverability

However, due to the shows short run and the brief appearance of the Space Rovers, only a few were ever seen...

http://community.fortunecity.ws/lavendar...

And only the female captain was given the 'official' name of Persia. Fan made names for the others sen in their brief appearance have come about.

http://metalexveemon.deviantart.com/art/...

Aside from the Space Rovers only a total of three other CanoSapians made an appearance.

Professor Hubert - A bloodhound with a powerful nose who worked in the lab and helped the rovers on a couple of occasions using his RnD skills and powerful sense of smell to identify a stray strand of hair from every animal species they had on record.

http://gerhard.n.tripod.com/tiger/otherp...

Confusus - an 'old dog of the mountain' the rovers go to for guidance in a tough situation and has a thing for cocktail weenies (the cheesy kind).
http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130...

And lastly there was the temporary Canosapian 'Sport', he was made an honorary rover so he could testify in trial against the man who attacked his owner, being the only witness.

http://fc02.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2011/0...

Aside from that all 'Rovers's since the shows cancellation have been fan made. In this expanded universe the Rovers have grown to the point where they're a full organization. Hunter and his team are the 'Alphas' but there are many other teams that can be populated by fan made characters.

I only request that if you add them in here, keep their powers reasonable and not go overboard, and give us nice descriptions of each character you bring in. And be aware that since this is open to all, and character you create can be controlled by whoever writes the next chapter.

info.brief_description: From the old cartoon Road Rovers. It's time the hero's got a bit of inflation or fattening
info.description:
The Road Rovers are in the open now, known for what they are and assuming the roles of an international police force of sorts. Still, they find time to have fun and relax, but, with what happens now, is it relaxation or the result of a mission?
You decide.
Now, the rules: No gore, no death, no overly brutal mangling. Sex is ok, but don’t dominate chapters on it. This is an inflation/expansion story. Sex of M/M or F/F is ok too, but again, don’t play it up too much. Additional characters may be added to the six Rover team, but this is not a place to stick your own character in. If you create a new Rover, consider that anybody after you will be able to use them however they want. Lastly, I’d like to keep humans out of the story if possible. I know ‘The Master’ is human, but as a rule of thumb, keep all humans to an absolute minimum please.
Other than that, have fun. :)
